"For the last 10 years, we have all been equally involved in making decisions," Eric Schmidt wrote in a post on Google's Blog, referring to himself, Page, and Sergey Brin . This triumvirate approach has real benefits in terms of shared wisdom, and we will continue to discuss the big decisions among the three of us. But we have also agreed to clarify our individual roles so there's clear responsibility and accountability at the top of the company. As a result, Page will lead product development and technology strategy within Google and take over Eric Schmidt 's day-to-day role as CEO starting April 4.
